title: Radim Holub
text:
Radim Holub (born 12 November 1975) is a <a href="Czech%20Republic">Czech</a> former <a href="association%20football">football</a> player. He played more than 300 games in the <a href="Czech%20First%20League">Czech First League</a> for various clubs including <a href="FK%20Jablonec">Jablonec</a>, <a href="FC%20Hradec%20Kr%C3%A1lov%C3%A9">Hradec Králové</a>, <a href="AC%20Sparta%20Prague">Sparta Prague</a>, <a href="FK%20Mlad%C3%A1%20Boleslav">Mladá Boleslav</a> and <a href="FK%20Drnovice">Drnovice</a>. He won the <a href="2000%E2%80%9301%20Czech%20First%20League">2000–01 Czech First League</a> with Sparta Prague.
Following his professional career, Holub moved to <a href="MFK%20Chrudim">MFK Chrudim</a> to play on an amateur basis.
